page.title: 06The View from Portsdown Hill
page.content: From Portsdown Hill there is a magnificent panoramic view of all Portsea Island, Spithead, The Nab Tower, Langstone Harbour, Hayling Island, and the Isle of Wight on the horizon. In Portsmouth you can see all the high buildings like St. Mary's Church, Portsmouth Harbour and the ferries going to France and the Channel Islands. To the west is Portchester Castle (built by the Romans). In the foreground is the motorway which goes to Fareham, Southampton, and now to the New Forest. On a very clear day it is possible to see St. John's Church on the Isle of Wight.
